comments:
When I select  
Window -> Show Views -> Others... -> Basic -> Internal Web Browser  
Eclipse return the following error:  
  
Embedded browser not available  
  
The embedded browser widget for this editor cannot be created. It is either not  
available for your operating system or the system needs to be configured in  
order to support embedded browser.  
  
Details<<  
No more handles [Unknown Mozilla path (MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME not set)]  
org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles [Unknown Mozilla path  
(MOZILA_FIVE_HOME not set)]  
 at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2968) 
 at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser.<init>(Browser.java:130) 
 .............

This is an SWT issue.

As the error message indicates, you need to tell Eclipse where to find the necessary Mozilla runtime libraries either by setting the MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME environmental variable before launching Eclipse, or setting up an appropriate gre.conf (both of which should preferrably be handled by your distribution).

More information can be found in the SWT FAQ: http://www.eclipse.org/swt/faq.php#browserlinux

This bug was moved to 'closed' state, since it is so old is is assumed its dup, invalid, or worksforme resolution is no longer in qustion and the bugzilla needs no further attention. Feel free to re-open, or open a new bug, if this semi-automatic processing was done in error in this case.
